A massive blaze engulfed an apartment building in Manhattan, while Brooklyn faced car terror incidents; Bronx tenants reported heat and gas outages, and NYC airports experienced delays amid FAA flight cuts. Additionally, Mayor-elect Mamdani's fare-free bus plan was rejected, and a Veterans Day parade is set for Tuesday.

### Risks & Alerts

- Massive blaze rips through apartment building in Manhattan, causing significant damage. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Bronx NYCHA tenants report heat and gas outages affecting living conditions. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMixwFBVV95cUxNNjJwZW5reE5DY0V4TXByZlJieWlwTWROZ1daSnBlWnRqY0NEWExPNExuUzJWLTNWZkJWbi16YU9mVTVId0kzWXNENHJ4QkV6RjRBOFB6SURvdTJ5WE5YbHBhSzU5RjRlNVpRV1pMQy1IY3NzbnVuaFJXaGhSTlFPc1FzazNhMi1IV3JoQ1dybGJtWjZqdVZGMjBhTGF3c2kxRGlTQ3g5ZEtLUl9yenk1NUtIcWJyUHQ0bFBBc2RocS1qb2xlY05r?oc=5)
- Staten Island Railway partially suspended until Monday for maintenance, affecting commuters. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- NYC airports experiencing delays and cancellations due to FAA mandate to cut flights. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMimwFBVV95cUxQWFZrc0R1YXpQZXkwSldOUXdITDJPa0RFRHphUzFQOUV6b1A0Z3ZXZDVfYVlfVHpqR2FnTnY2aGVLS05qYkZKdDhENDl2dndoRFZHNjZuTG8wVFpjZ2dITTJNbEVUMFlaUFNoWGVUU3lOQjVSLUpyR01JY0NaakxvY05WSzlJLVdRWWhHcW9CdWhxblA2TnM1eFhGYw?oc=5)
